III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff qualifications
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112
Section (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
Description (a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff punched a youth in the face and kicked the youth.
Investigation Interviews:
On 11/6/24 Complainant reported that on 11/5/24 Youth A
threatened staff’s vehicle with a stick. Staff 1 and Youth A were
pulling on the stick, like “tug a war”. Staff 1 punched Youth A in
the face and kicked him. This did not result in any injuries.
Complainant was contacted on 11/7/24 and reported no additional
information. Complainant did not observe the incident.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 11/7/24, in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported she was
present on 11/5/24 when Youth A had a stick and made threats
towards staff. Staff 1 stated that Youth A began making the
threats towards her, as he was upset about not being allowed to
go on an outing. Youth A was unable to go on the outing due to
behavior that occurred earlier that day. Youth A approached Staff
1 and asked why he could not go on the outing. When Staff 1
reminded Youth A of the reason, he picked up the stick and
threatened to hit her car. Staff 1 verbally redirected Youth A, but
he did not listen. Staff 1 stepped away from the situation, as she
was the target of Youth A’s anger. Staff 3 stepped in to assist with
Youth A. Staff 2 and Staff 4 also assisted after Staff 1 walked
away. Staff 1 stated that she never hit or kicked Youth A, nor did
she participate in “tug of war” over the stick.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 11/7/24, in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2 reported she was
present for the incident on 11/5/24. When Youth A picked up the
stick and began threatening Staff 1’s car, Staff 1 walked away.
Staff 2 never observed Staff 1 grab the stick from Youth A, or hit
or kick Youth A. Staff 2 stated she and Staff 4 retrieved the stick
from Youth A.
2

Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 11/7/24, in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 3 reported she was
present for the incident on 11/5/24. Staff 3 observed Staff 1 talking
with Youth A. Youth A became upset and Staff 1 walked away, as
she felt she was the target of his anger. Youth A had picked up
some sticks and made threats toward staff. Staff 3 stated that she,
Staff 2 and Staff 4 attempted to talk with Youth A to get the sticks
away from him. Youth A then grabbed a tree branch and tried to
hit staff with it. Staff 4 assisted in taking the branch away. Youth A
then laid in the middle of the street, stated he did not care and
wanted to get hit by a car. Staff 3 and Staff 4 transported Youth A
to the crisis center for evaluation. Staff 3 reported she did not see
Staff 1, or any other staff hit or kick Youth A.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the crisis center on
11/7/24, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Youth A stated
that he was “acting up” on 11/5/24. Youth A recalled several staff
were talking to him, but he could not remember which staff. Youth
A stated he laid in the road and said he wanted to die, but he did
not mean it. Youth A was frustrated that he was unable to go on
an outing with some of his peers. Youth A could not recall why he
was not allowed to go on the outing. When asked about behavior
earlier in the day, Youth A became frustrated and said he did not
remember. However, Youth A recalled that prior to laying in the
road, he had a stick in his hands that he was trying to hit cars with.
Youth A stated that Staff 1 tried to grab the stick from him and
bumped his face with her hand on accident. Youth A denied Staff
1 punching him in the face. When asked if any staff kicked him,
Youth A said that Staff 1 may have bumped him in the leg with her
foot, but that was an accident too. During the interview, Youth A
became aware that crisis center staff were present as he was
staffed one-to-one. Once he became aware of the staff, Youth A
became agitated and ended the interview.
Staff 4 was interviewed by phone on 11/8/24, in collaboration with
MDHHS Worker. Staff 4 recalled that he assisted in removing the
stick from Youth A on 11/5/24 and transporting him to the crisis
center with Staff 3. Staff 4 stated that the incident began when
Youth A was informed he was not able to go on an outing. Youth
A became irate and began verbally threatening staff. Staff 4 tried
to verbally deescalate Youth A. Staff 4 spoke with Youth A about
good days/bad days and how to change things to make sure he
goes on the next outing. Youth A responded by trying to hit Staff
4. Youth A grabbed a stick from the ground when he saw Staff 1
and stated he was going to hurt her. Youth A approached Staff 1
and she verbally redirected him, then grabbed the end of the stick
3

to prevent being hit by it. Youth A began kicking and hitting Staff
1. Staff 1 raised her leg to block kicks from Youth A. Youth A ran
away and laid in the road, stating that he did not want to be there
anymore and wanted to kill himself. Staff 1 removed herself from
the situation. Staff 2 blocked the road to keep traffic from Youth A.
Staff 3 and Staff 4 spoke with Youth A and tried to get him to
move from the road. Eventually Staff 3 and Staff 4 were able to
deescalate and transport Youth A to the crisis center, where Staff
3 stayed with him for several hours. Staff 4 stated that Staff 1 did
not kick or punch Youth A at any time.
Video review
Chief Administrator provided video from the day and time of the
incident. However, Youth A’s interaction with Staff 1 was not on
camera.
Document Review
• Regarding the morning incident that prevented Youth A
from attending the outing: Incident report dated 11/5/24 at
12:50PM indicated Youth A had a verbal altercation with
another youth. Youth A attempted to hit the peer and staff
intervened to prevent a physical altercation. Youth A began
hitting and punching staff. Youth A ignored directives to
stop assaulting the peer and was placed in a standing hold.
Youth A was released from the restraint and went for a
walk with staff to calm down.
• Regarding the incident with the stick in the evening:
Incident report dated 11/5/24 at 6:26PM. Youth A was
upset that he was unable to attend an outing due to
assaultive behavior earlier that day. Youth A became
verbally aggressive and attempted to leave line of sight.
Youth A picked up branches and returned to the facility,
where he became physically aggressive. Youth A then laid
in the middle of the street, stating he wanted to kill himself.
Staff 1, Staff 2 and Staff 4 spoke with Youth A. Youth A
returned to baseline and was transported to crisis center for
suicidal ideation evaluation.
Analysis Based on interviews with the youth and staff there is no
information to support the allegation.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
4
